kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
1. Create an Image content type ([one with a Content item asset field](https://docs.kentico.com/business-users/content-hub#upload-a-single-file)) to model your image. **We do not** support files outside of an associated content item like you might see in a classic media library. You can't just "upload a file" to a widget. 2. Create [a widget based on a View Component](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/development/builders/page-builder/widgets-for-page-builder#widgets-based-on-a-view-component) with some [widget properties](https://docs.kentico.com/x/7wWiCQ). 3. Assign [the combined content selector](https://docs.kentico.com/developers-and-admins/customization/extend-the-administration-interface/ui-form-components/reference-admin-ui-form-components#combined-content-selector) to one of those widget properties and configure the selector to only allow selection of the Image content type. 4. Retrieve the widget properties in the widget's `InvokeAsync` method and use [the content retrieval APIs](https://docs.kentico.com/x/OKrWCQ) to retrieve the Image content items identified by the items selected in the widget properties. The widget property values will be the `ContentItemGUID` values of the selected Image content items. 5. Create [a View Model for the widget](https://docs.kentico.com/guides/development/page-builder/define-advanced-widget#create-the-widget-view-model) and populate it with the Image content items you retrieved. 6. Render the View Model in the Razor view used by the widget. 7. Done!
You can see a full example of an image widget in [the Kentico Community Portal source code](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v30.1.0.11/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/Components/Widgets/Image/ImageWidget.cs).
